definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: The census in the world's second-most populous country is held every 10 years.
sentences.chinese: 印度每十年舉行一次人口普查。

sentences.english: No Brian, I think you mean for the census.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲你說的是人口普查。

sentences.english: Their model’s predictions match well with the early census data.
sentences.chinese: 這個模型預測的結果與早期的人口普查數據契合良好。

sentences.english: Last year's national census count estimated the population at six hundred twenty-one thousand.
sentences.chinese: 去年全國人口普查數估計在六十二萬一人口。

sentences.english: The census undercounted the agricultural population.
sentences.chinese: 人口普查少算了農業人口。

sentences.english: Past censuses have not reported data on gays who consider themselves married.
sentences.chinese: 上次人口普查並沒有報道同性婚姻的數據。

sentences.english: Census employment may make it more difficult for companies to find part-time help, he said.
sentences.chinese: 人口普查往往能夠使得企業更難找到臨時工。

sentences.english: In the end, they decided to get married after census.
sentences.chinese: 最終，他們決定在人口普查之後結婚。

sentences.english: The census is the subject of perennial squabbles.
sentences.chinese: 人口普查一直是人們爭論的主題。

sentences.english: The Census has a history of undercounting residents in urban cities like Detroit.
sentences.chinese: 過去，人口普查通常會漏掉一些城市居民。

sentences.english: The government uses the higher figure believing that many “black children” were missed by censuses.
sentences.chinese: 政府使用較高的數字是考慮人口普查漏掉的“黑孩”。

sentences.english: Decennial census, the United Kingdom March 27 will be conducted this year.
sentences.chinese: 每十年一次的英國人口普查將於今年3月27日進行。

sentences.english: Also, we don't have accurate censuses until the 19th century.
sentences.chinese: 況且，直到十九世紀我們纔有了，精確的人口普查。

sentences.english: Mather talked about other trends he expects the 2010 U.S. Census to reveal.
sentences.chinese: 馬瑟談到了今年人口普查將反映出來的新趨勢。

sentences.english: The pictures show a working meeting of the Third National Census and computers funded by UNFPA.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲人口普查工作會議和聯合國人口基金捐助的電腦。

sentences.english: In this census, an increase in the number of illiterates was observed.
sentences.chinese: 在這次人口普查中發現文盲人數增多。

definition: population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
to apply for residence/to register a birth
to become naturalized/to become a citizen

pinyin: guo2 min2 sheng1 chan3 zong3 zhi2
